story:
Generally, when people think of an anamorphic lens, two words come to mind – heavy and expensive. Film production companies and well-off photographers buy these premium lenses without hesitation. But for cinematic enthusiasts, who adore the unique anamorphic features and cinematic look of anamorphic lenses, it is quite difficult for them to purchase one.

However, SIRUI disrupted the anamorphic industry last year. With our innovative R&D and excellent manufacturing process, SIRUI launched the affordable and high-value 50mm F1.8 1.33x Anamorphic Lens, which amassed over $1.3 million in sales through Indiegogo and earned rave reviews from numerous media outlets and photographers.

 

 

 

Drawing on our experience with the 50mm Anamorphic Lens, SIRUI achieved a focal length breakthrough, enabling us to deliver an affordable 35mm F/1.8 1.33x Anamorphic Lens.  With our newest lens on the market, there is now another high-quality and affordable, wider-frame anamorphic option for cinematographers and cinematic enthusiasts. By combining the two SIRUI Anamorphic Lenses, you can capture your imagination and create breathtaking, cinematic shots.

Built according to the highest standards, this brand new anamorphic pro lens achieves the field of view of a 26.3mm camera lens by widening the horizontal FOV up to 33%. Ideal for users who want a wider cinematic look, the 35mm Anamorphic Lens is a gamechanger, providing a superb, silky depth of field and oval bokeh.

 

Due to the popularity of cinematic aesthetics, photographers and shutterbugs usually convert a 16:9 camera shot into a 2.4:1 cinematic aspect ratio via post-editing applications. Although this method achieves a cinematic look, it also degrades the footage and results in lower quality images.

  

Shot with general 35mm camera Lens
Shot with SIRUI 35mm Anamorphic Lens

 

When shooting with a compatible camera, the 35mm F1.8 Anamorphic Lens uses its 1.33x squeeze factor to widen the horizontal field of view and produce a wider, full HD 2.4:1 cinematic video without any post-cropping.

Capture more through the 35mm focal length. With a simple switch to the SIRUI 50mm Anamorphic Lens, extend your shots for perfect cinematic work.

Shot with SIRUI 50MM Anamorphic Lens
Shot with SIRUI 35MM Anamorphic Lens

 

Shot with SIRUI 50MM Anamorphic Lens
Shot with SIRUI 35MM Anamorphic Lens

 

Shot with SIRUI 50MM Anamorphic Lens
Shot with SIRUI 35MM Anamorphic Lens

 

 

Special in its anamorphic structure and multilayer Nano-coatings, this 35mm lens softens and controls lights within a scene using the special function, Sci-Fi Blue Light Streaks with Pleasing Star Burst.

Backlighting Effect

As users adjust the aperture, the unique light streaks and star burst will adapt to the aperture value for the optimum cinematic visual effect.

Backlighting Effect + Blur Light Streak with Star Burst

 

Eye your scenes through the lens and revive their beauty by adjusting the light setting between the F/1.8 and F/16 apertures. Even wide open at F/1.8, this lens can still produce sharp, quality imaging with a smooth depth of field when targeting the subject/object using the 35mm focal length.

DOF AT DAY
DOF AT NIGHT

 

 

Due to the 1.33x squeeze factor, the round light spots in the background will de-squeeze into an enchanting oval bokeh, which couples with the foreground for an aesthetic upgrade.

Oval Bokeh Effect without Subject
Oval Bokeh Effect with Subject

 

 

Well-built with an innovative optical lens structure and German-manufactured Schott optical glass lens elements, the anamorphic expert lens minimizes optical distortion and lens breathing effects and functions perfectly to generate superb cinematic imaging.

This portable lens also excels at controlling chromatic dispersion to produce unique visual characteristics and provide sharp, high resolution images.

 

The 35mm Anamorphic Lens is solidly constructed with aircraft aluminum alloy and a precision CNC machining process.

The compact lens further optimizes focusing and aperture control systems using the two additional Gear Rings (0.8 Module). They’re attached to the built-in Focus and Aperture Rings, and they’re designed with a comfortable anti-slip teeth surface..

Manually adjust the focusing and light settings with precision scale marks on the ultra-smooth, copper Focus and Aperture Rings.

 

The 35mm lens can attach to an M4/3 mirrorless camera and fit onto an APS-C mirrorless camera with a selection of E, EF-M, and Z lens mounts by attaching the optional adapter rings.

*  Switch to an APS-C format before shooting with a compatible full-frame camera.

* In some scenarios, a little bit of vignetting might occur when using the lens while it’s attached with an adapter ring.

Compared to general camera lenses, the SIRUI 35mm F1.8 1.33x Anamorphic Lens can easily produce a cinematic widescreen look for users without post-cropping or using additional tools to highlight their creative shots.

Furthermore, this lightweight 35mm Anamorphic Lens delivers high-quality, cinematic imaging for users at a great value. It is a perfect companion for commercial directors, studio photographers, vloggers, cinematographers and cinematic enthusiasts.

 

 

Caution: Please remember to choose an ADD-ON for your selected Perk at CHECK-OUT if you need an adapter ring. Choosing an ADD-ON at a later date will cause delivery delays or results in additional shipping cost of customer's account.​

 

SIRUI’s August crowdfunding campaign is a pre-launch of our new product line and an opportunity for cinematographers and cinematic enthusiasts alike to be the first to experience the SIRUI 35mm F1.8 1.33x Camera Anamorphic Lens in advance of our official launch.

 

 

 

 

 

Since 2001, SIRUI has always striven to move forward and continue expanding the SIRUI Brand. With innovative R&D, an excellent manufacturing process and worldwide marketing, SIRUI has become a global enterprise, developing, manufacturing and marketing photographic products.

Manufactured with high standards, SIRUI’s innovative photographic products have received numerous accolades and awards at notable international events including the 2018 Red Dot Design Awards, the 2018 German Design Awards, CES 2019 and NAB Show 2019. SIRUI greatly appreciates the ongoing support of our customers and the professional photography community.

SIRUI is committed to providing excellence in product performance and functionality. Drawing on our experience in product development, design and production, it is our goal to provide our customers with high-quality, innovative photographic products to advance the progress of the Imaging Industry. That’s why SIRUI achieved big success with the 50mm F1.8 1.33x Anamorphic Lens. Since its launch, the 50mm Anamorphic Lens has gained tremendous popularity in professional media organizations and among photographers. To diversify the anamorphic lens line, SIRUI is launching the brand-new professional 35mm F1.8 Anamorphic 1.33x Lens for users to extend the capability of their shoots.

 

          

Follow @SIRUIImaging
story_txt:
Generally, when people think of an anamorphic lens, two words come to mind – heavy and expensive. Film production companies and well-off photographers buy these premium lenses without hesitation. But for cinematic enthusiasts, who adore the unique anamorphic features and cinematic look of anamorphic lenses, it is quite difficult for them to purchase one.However, SIRUI disrupted the anamorphic industry last year. With our innovative R&D and excellent manufacturing process, SIRUI launched the affordable and high-value 50mm F1.8 1.33x Anamorphic Lens, which amassed over $1.3 million in sales through Indiegogo  and earned rave reviews from numerous media outlets and photographers.    Drawing on our experience with the 50mm Anamorphic Lens, SIRUI achieved a focal length breakthrough, enabling us to deliver an affordable 35mm F/1.8 1.33x Anamorphic Lens.  With our newest lens on the market, there is now another high-quality and affordable, wider-frame anamorphic option for cinematographers and cinematic enthusiasts. By combining the two SIRUI Anamorphic Lenses, you can capture your imagination and create breathtaking, cinematic shots.Built according to the highest standards, this brand new anamorphic pro lens achieves  the field of view of a 26.3mm camera lens by widening the horizontal FOV up to 33%. Ideal for users who want a wider cinematic look, the 35mm Anamorphic Lens is a gamechanger, providing a superb, silky depth of field and oval bokeh. Due to the popularity of cinematic aesthetics, photographers and shutterbugs usually  convert a 16:9 camera shot into a 2.4:1 cinematic aspect ratio  via post-editing applications. Although this method achieves a cinematic look, it also degrades the footage and results in lower quality images.  Shot with general 35mm camera LensShot with SIRUI 35mm Anamorphic Lens When shooting with a compatible camera, the 35mm F1.8 Anamorphic Lens uses its 1.33x squeeze factor to widen the horizontal field of view and produce a wider, full HD 2.4:1 cinematic video without any post-cropping.Capture more through the 35mm focal length. With a simple switch to the SIRUI 50mm Anamorphic Lens, extend your shots for perfect cinematic work.Shot with SIRUI 50MM Anamorphic LensShot with SIRUI 35MM Anamorphic Lens Shot with SIRUI 50MM Anamorphic LensShot with SIRUI 35MM Anamorphic Lens Shot with SIRUI 50MM Anamorphic LensShot with SIRUI 35MM Anamorphic Lens  Special in its anamorphic structure and multilayer Nano-coatings, this 35mm lens softens and controls lights within a scene using the special function, Sci-Fi Blue Light Streaks with Pleasing Star Burst. Backlighting EffectAs users adjust the aperture, the unique light streaks and star burst will adapt to the aperture value for the optimum cinematic visual effect.Backlighting Effect + Blur Light Streak with Star Burst Eye your scenes through the lens and revive their beauty by adjusting the light setting between the F/1.8 and F/16 apertures. Even wide open at F/1.8, this lens can still produce sharp, quality imaging  with a smooth depth of field when targeting the subject/object using the 35mm focal length.
DOF AT DAY
DOF AT NIGHT
  Due to the 1.33x squeeze factor, the round light spots in the background will de-squeeze into an enchanting oval bokeh, which couples with the foreground for an aesthetic upgrade.
Oval Bokeh Effect without Subject
Oval Bokeh Effect with Subject
  Well-built with an innovative optical lens structure and German-manufactured Schott optical glass lens elements, the anamorphic expert lens minimizes optical distortion and lens breathing effects and functions perfectly to generate superb cinematic imaging.This portable lens also excels at controlling chromatic dispersion to produce unique visual characteristics and provide sharp, high resolution images. The 35mm Anamorphic Lens is solidly constructed with aircraft aluminum alloy and a precision CNC machining process.The compact lens further optimizes focusing and aperture control systems using the two additional Gear Rings (0.8 Module). They’re attached to the built-in Focus and Aperture Rings, and they’re designed with a comfortable anti-slip teeth surface..Manually adjust the focusing and light settings with  precision scale marks on the ultra-smooth, copper Focus and Aperture Rings. The 35mm lens can attach to an M4/3 mirrorless camera and fit onto an APS-C mirrorless camera with a selection of E, EF-M, and Z lens mounts by attaching the optional adapter rings.*  Switch to an APS-C format before shooting with a compatible full-frame camera.* In some scenarios, a little bit of vignetting might occur when using the lens while it’s attached with an adapter ring.Compared to general camera lenses, the SIRUI 35mm F1.8 1.33x Anamorphic Lens can easily produce a cinematic widescreen look for users without post-cropping or using additional tools to highlight their creative shots.Furthermore, this lightweight 35mm Anamorphic Lens delivers high-quality, cinematic imaging for users at a great value. It is a perfect companion for commercial directors, studio photographers, vloggers, cinematographers and cinematic enthusiasts.  Caution: Please remember to choose an ADD-ON for your selected Perk at CHECK-OUT if you need an adapter ring. Choosing an ADD-ON at a later date will cause delivery delays or results in additional shipping cost of customer's account.​ SIRUI’s August crowdfunding campaign is a pre-launch of our new product line and an opportunity for cinematographers and cinematic enthusiasts alike to be the first to experience the SIRUI 35mm F1.8 1.33x Camera Anamorphic Lens in advance of our official launch.     Since 2001, SIRUI has always striven to move forward and continue expanding the SIRUI Brand. With innovative R&D, an excellent manufacturing process and worldwide marketing, SIRUI has become a global enterprise, developing, manufacturing and marketing photographic products.Manufactured with high standards, SIRUI’s innovative photographic products have received numerous accolades and awards at notable international events including the 2018 Red Dot Design Awards, the 2018 German Design Awards, CES 2019 and NAB Show 2019. SIRUI greatly appreciates the ongoing support of our customers and the professional photography community.SIRUI is committed to providing excellence in product performance and functionality. Drawing on our experience in product development, design and production, it is our goal to provide our customers with high-quality, innovative photographic products to advance the progress of the Imaging Industry. That’s why SIRUI achieved big success with the 50mm F1.8 1.33x Anamorphic Lens. Since its launch, the 50mm Anamorphic Lens has gained tremendous popularity in professional media organizations and among photographers. To diversify the anamorphic lens line, SIRUI is launching the brand-new professional 35mm F1.8 Anamorphic 1.33x Lens for users to extend the capability of their shoots.           Follow @SIRUIImaging

story:
The Smart Light is a fixture concept which combines light source, battery, and remote controller into a single product. All you need to add is a phone or a computer as an interface. No extra software licenses and no more hardware needed.

The Voyager is the next step in the Digital Sputnik product range. We have taken our DS product line and packed the full feature set into this small fixture. Then, we added batteries, an animation controller and made the package waterproof. When using current light controller boards, a technician needs to address every single light manually. With Voyager the software can autodetect fixtures on the set making this manual labor obsolete.

The Devil is in the details, and we have ten finished prototypes that look and sometimes even behave like finished products. Now we need to take the final step.

The last 10% of the project costs as much as the first 90% - therefore, providing a high-quality product in a timely fashion with bug-free software requires a lot of effort, and that is where you can help! Please support this endeavor so we could provide tools for your next creative project.

With the Voyager it is possible to use Your favorite diffusion filter by LEE or Rosco. There are two slots to install the filter. The first layer is inside the diffuser tube. The second layer is right over the LEDs, and the cutout strip mounts right into the groove around the LEDs.

 

We have a myriad of features planned for the future releases. Having more money to invest into our development team, we can have some of the features implemented much faster. Once the support for the project reaches 500 000 stretch goal, we can introduce the built-in WiFi router for every Voyager unit shipped.
The biggest hurdle with WiFi controlled devices on set is the work of setting up the reliable network. There are very few routers available that are suitable for on-set work. Every Voyager unit would offer a straightforward wireless network setup procedure. All You have to do is set one unit as the router and continue to build Your set. Once You switch on the following fixtures, they will automatically connect to the router within one minute. The system will work best within 10 meters (30 feet) radius.

 

By reaching 600 000 stretch goal, the Voyager units will ship with 200fps animation engine. DMX512 allows only ~42fps as maximum update speed becoming a major limitation for high frame rate VR/AR applications. All the Voyager units will ship with 200fps animation engine that is configurable with Lightgrading software but usable via ArtNet, sACN or OSC devices. The user can create custom animations with a simple point and click interface and use the fixture in DMX controlled set. The 1st channel will select preset animation saved in the fixture, and the rest will manage the animation properties. 

 

If You guys help us reach 800 000 stretch goal, we will offer one free Voyager Converter (DMX/RDM interface) dongle to every backer. 
The Voyager Converter will incorporate any RGB LED fixture into Lightgrading software realm. The Lightgrading software allows simple color control and a finger drawn animation of lights. The auto-detection system will be modified to accommodate any 3rd party fixture detection. Advanced AI learning makes it possible to detect any lighting product even with modifiers. The unit will require 1A 5V power over micro USB connector.

 

 

The fixture can be used fully submerged up to 2 meters of depth for short time periods (30min). The 2-meter maximum is to keep the manufacturing cost and weight of the unit reasonable.

We will provide a BTO option for an extra 150USD/2ft, 200USD/4ft per fixture to enhance the operational depth to 10 meters. These units will ship with wired control for fixed large-scale installations.

 

Voyager is ideal for photography. A single operator workflow is much simpler with all the light controls under your fingertips. The animation feature can be used for long exposure takes. Voyager has a manual flash function, and it is possible to time it down to 1/500th/sec.

 

 

Yes, You might have. Here is one video production that has used Voyager very early and it was then a hyper-fragile prototype.

 

Voyager is also a great fit for social media use

or stills photography 

 

Here is a clip by Matt Workman from cinematography database with hands-on experience with the alpha software without autodetect feature. The final software will run on iOS, Android, Windows and OSX. The effects can be created (in python) and shared amongst users.

 

Inspired by working with the best in the industry, we’re building the tools for a new generation of filmmakers.

Our DS line fixtures have been used as the main lighting tool on some of the highest grossing motion pictures in the world. We have redesigned the lighting workflow into a portable and more affordable toolset. Historically, this has been a technological solution reserved for only a select few.

Join us, as we set out to take the experience of filmmaking to the next level, offering you the creative freedom.

 

We have ten prototypes of roughly the final spec fixtures, and mostly we need the help to get reasonable pricing for the project to scale up the production from the get go. We are still learning and will do our very best to keep the proposed deadlines while not compromising on providing highest possible quality hard and software. 

Underwater is much more complicated than originally anticipated. To get solid housing that can withstand both positive and negative pressure without accumulating condensated water inside is difficult. We decided to go with the BTO option when the battery and controller compartment is filled with solid foam so there would be no room for water to get in. 

We have made some of the supplier deals, and some we are still working on. The bigger support we can get on the campaign the better deal we will get to you by testing and releasing software features faster. Please support our project!

story:
Summary

I'm a photographer working in the Chicago area. My work can be seen at my portiflio site: http://sdphotographer.virb.com/

and on flickr at http://www.flickr.com/photos/90612705@N07

 

Earlier this month, my camera was stolen on my way home from an event. This loss, in addition to being traumatic and costly, comes at a particularly unfortunate time, as I am in the process of greatly expanding my practice and building my professional body of work. I am in the middle of several major projects, one of which I can afford to lose very little time from (as documenting seasonal change is an important theme). It is therefore imperative that I replace my camera and get back to work as soon as possible.


What We Need & What You Get

 

I am a working artist and to put it bluntly cannot afford to replace the gear that I lost out of pocket. Without your help, I will be unable to continue my practice and will have to abandon the body of work I have labored to build. This loss of productive time will be far more devastating and have far greater consequences than the mere loss of personal property. Therefore, time is of the essence.

 

My goal is to replace my lost kit with the same or similar used gear, which will cost approximately $800.

 

In exchange for your contribution, I am offering photographic prints on the following schedule:

 

Contributions of $25-49: one 5x7 inch print

 

Contributions of $50-99: one 8x19 inch print

 

Contributions of 100-199: one 11x14 inch print

 

Contributions of 200 and up: one 14x17 inch print

 

All images on my flickr account are available!

 

If you wish to request a specific image for your print, please contact me with its flickr url. Otherwise, I will select one of my favorite images from my recent work for your reward.

 

All prints will be signed and numbered by the artist.

 

PLEASE MAKE SURE TO INCLUDE YOUR CONTATCT INFORMATION either via leaving a comment or PM. I can not send you your print without your contact information.

 

The Impact

Your contribution will be directly responsible for permitting a young professional artist to continue their practice. This is no small matter and whether you give $25 or $200, I will be forever grateful for your help in my recovery from this horrible episode in my early career.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially but still want to help, please share this campaign on social media.

 

If you would like to contribute but for whatever reason do not want to give money through indiegogo, I have a limited selection of work available for sale on Society6.

story:
JEDEYE is a stylish stereoscopic camera designed for both personal and business users who are serious about stereoscopic photography and image quality. You can get quite good quality with the camera even under a challenging low light environment. By using the accompanied app, You can easily share the videos with your family and friends. When viewed through VR headset (with smartphone) or 3D TV, these 3D videos show a strong stereoscopic effect. With a built-in 2000mAh lithium battery, JEDEYE can easily support up to 2 hours continuous recording. It's also very cute, and can be easily put into your pocket.

With our first demo prototype in May, several rounds of ID rework, we are almost there. We started shipping limited number of near-production JEDEYE to early customers and Stanford University even picked the developer's version of JEDEYE for its graduate level image system engineering class.After almost one year of hard work, we are ready to spread the fun of stereo photography. Are you ready?

 

1) Designed by a veteran imaging team from strong ties to Stanford University

2) The combination of surveillance-grade image sensors and advanced algorithms allows you to record fun events even under challenging low light situations

3) Record 3x FHD and HDR 3D video

4) Fast motion mode at 3040*1520@60fps

See a comparison video here:

 

Sample Video -- Puppy

 

Sample Video -- Dancing

 

JEDEYE’s sports mode allows you to record 3D video at 60 FPS (frames per second)

Some Samples -- Baby

 With surveillance-grade image sensors and advanced algorithms, you won’t miss the fun in low light situations.

Low Light Comparison

Compared with another stereo camera

For scenes with very uneven light, JEDEYS’s WDR mode will do the job for you.

 

1) Family

First step

Birthday

Pets

 2) Intimacy

Partner

 3) Sports

 4) Outdoor

Record with Gimbal

 

The JEDEYE camera can be used to record video or capture image alone. Also, the JEDEYE camera can be used with the provided smartphone APP, Jedeye Player. And the APP gives you full access to JEDEYE camera. You can configure the camera, live-preview, record and share captured 3D videos with family and friends through 3D-capable social networks. Once video get recorded, user can insert the smartphone into a VR glasses to enjoy the recorded video with our JEDEYE player.

 

 

 

The APP gives you full access to JEDEYE camera. And you can configure the camera, live-preview, record and share captured 3D videos with family and friends through 3D-capable social networks.   

 

 

You can enjoy 3D videos with VR headset or 3D-ready TV.

 The quality of the 3D video is amzing, just put on a VR glass!

 

 

 

JEDEYE is the followup version of our commercial stereo camera (code name POTOO) release in 2016 for live-streaming applications. While commercial users found POTOO fun to use, it was bulky and could only work along with computers.  

POTOO

In order to spread the fun, we decided to start the consumer version stereo camera project (code name JEDEYE) in Jan 2017, a major overhaul of the original POTOO project with better image quality, lighter/stylish design, built-in battery, smartphone APPs, you name it. It was never an easy task going from commercial to consumer and fortunately our team stood up to all the challenges.

JEDEYE Prototype

Appearance design

Color design

  

Prototype iteration

story:
At Blind Spot Gear we're on a mission to make the most portable, flexible and innovative power and lighting solutions for the creative industries. This is Blind Spot's 6th Kickstarter, what a journey it's been! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

In Car Lighting with the Crack Light

First Review- Demos start at 1.35

.

The film below is a quick example of how you can use the Crack Light along with any smart phone to improve your on the move vlogging. The phone used was an iPhone 8 with the front facing camera. Vlogging might not be for everyone but this video clearly demonstrates how effective the light can be.

 

 

 

 

We want to offer you a full range of add-ons and are busy negotiating with our supplier to get the best possible quality and cost, everything you see above you will be able to purchase from us. After this campaign finishes we will have a full range of add-ons that you will be able to purchase when giving us your shipping information. 

Do you want more Crack Lights? Increase your reward by the corresponding pound amount. You do not need to add any extra money for shipping beyond the shipping surcharge that is part of your reward. That’s it, you’re done for now. No need to do anything else until after the project ends on April the 12th. See our FAQ for more info.

story:
Short Summary

Hi there folks! 

although i am hesitant to ask for money from my friends and family, i am really excited about this opportunity to expand my photography experience and provide more for clients, and sometimes you gotta just ask.  ANYTHING HELPS! $20-$10-$5 !  

For those of you who dont know me, or as well as some- I am a 'retired' real estate appraiser and been enjoying photography for 40 years so it seemed like a natural expansion to offer services to real estate agents, and others.  I work with a great company called Look2 Homes (look2homes.com) that a close friend built with a little input from me (thanks Tyler). We have developed some great processes and love what we do.  Lately however the market is demanding a wider range of products to help sell homes. I wanted to do this some time back and now that the Colorado Springs branch is offering this aerial option it has seen success and happy clients. 

I dont have the money to drop for the new equipment (especially since my current still camera gear was not cheap either) and i am still currently in grad school. The flexible schedule of shooting real estate is priceless for my studies!  I enjoy my job so much, it doesnt feel like a job most days. The people i work for are always great and the homeowners frequently call to thank me for the wonderful images of thier home.  Recently i have had a few clients ask if i have this aerial  capability and it pains me to lose business to other companies who do, but thats business right? so here we are...


I need to get the equipment to keep  current clients and gather more.

Let me be more specific on my desires: again anything helps

  • Drone (or radio controlled copter) basics: motors, props,  about $ 500
  • flight controller system with GPS  about $300
  • radio 7-8 channel w receiver about $300
  • camera (GoPro Hero type) and gimbal mount system $700
  • Real time transmitter and monitor for ground $300-$400
  • misc batteries, case, charger, etc $300

The Impact

I also hope this will lead to more fun projects filming for fiends,  at car shows, family picnics, snowboarding trips, camping, sky's the limit haha  

  • marketing homes is only one piece, but its a BIG one with lots of opportunity
  • I have been self employed and in the real estate industry for almost 15 years and i have the people skills and contacts to grow this effectively. 
  • those of you who know me personally know my integrity and honesty is above question and i pride myself in customer service, its my product.

Risks & Challenges

I wont say this will be an overnight success, but it has great potential.  Learning to fly and control the camera simultaneously will take practice (and i love a challenge). Weather and other hurdles will arise on daily basis but thats nothing new. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cant help out with a small donation, please pass on the word about our services to Realtors or whomever may have a use for this type of photography
  • Take advantage of  the Indiegogo share tools and help me get the word out!
if you need to sell your home i have a friends and family discount for photos ;) and have a big referral list of industry pros

*the video i copied is not mine, but thought you would like to see something like what i will be doing- search YouTube for amazing aerial footage -there are hours of scenic and fun clips

story:
Hi! 

My name is Aggi.
Natalia is one of my best and closest friends. Most importantly though, she is one of the most talented photographers I have ever come across. This is the reason why I created this campaign.

A few months ago, the two of us decided to organise a photography exhibition, bringing our photographs out of our blogs and onto the walls.

Sadly, a few days ago, Natalia's camera broke. This caused a lot of serious problems since Natalia uses that same camera for work. At the moment she is forced to borrow her boss's camera at her own risk, in order to work, but also isn't able to use it for her personal projects.

What I'm trying to do is getting all of Natalia's friends and work admirers to raise the amount of 1.700 euros. That is the price of a Cannon 6D. A camera that would cover all her needs as a photographer.

Natalia has studied photography in Athens, Greece.
She has been working as a freelance photographer since 2008.
In 2010 she started "Luminous Beings", a blog through which she shares her photography with the world.

Her wildest dream is to photograph the Amazon's wild life.

story:
FAQ:

 

1. Can I use my DSLR with the system?

Trek allows for camera setups up to 1 lb. for horizontal movement and up to 8 oz. for vertical movement.

2. What is the range of speed?

For continuous motion, Trek can move from 1 inch per minute all the way to 36 inches per minute.

Our Advanced and Night modes introduce stepping functionality, where you can take a shot as slow as 3 feet in 8.5 hours.

What is the range of speed?For continuous motion, Trek can move from 1 inch per minute all the way to 36 inches per minute.Our Advanced and Night modes introduce stepping functionality, where you can take a shot as slow as 3 feet in 8.5 hours.

story:
Hi,

Trying to raise some money to be able to add iPhone 7 and iPhone SE if enough is raised the test devices we use on the YouTube Channel iAppleBytes.

The add revenue is limited, especially when AddBlocking software is getting more and more popular. 

So if you like to see us compare iPhone 6S and the 5 SE  on the channel, you can help speed that up by donating a small amount to the cause.

The money raised will be used to purchase 
2 x 32GB iPhone 7 devices. 
and if enough is raised also 
2 x 16GB iPhone SE devices.

They will forever be included in future firmware testing videos, when new firmware (also beta firmware) is  released by Apple.

Today we are able to test iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, iPhone 5S, iPhone 6 and iPhone 6S devices.  But would so much love to add the newest Apple iPhones to the testing.

Hope you are able to chip in..

story:
With super light reduction capability, the Aurora PowerND family of fixed neutral density filters is the best light reduction tool for the uncompromising photographer.

 

 

The Aurora PowerND family consists of three light reduction ratings: 

ND64 - 6 stops 

ND4000 - 12 stops 

ND65000 - 16 stops

The 6 stop filter is typically used in low light conditions such as sunrise and sunset. Using a 6 stop filter can reduce shutter speed to a few seconds in those conditions. 

The 12 stop filter can be used to slow down shutter speed further to minutes in dusk and dawn conditions, or a few seconds during daylight. 

The 16 stop filter can do magic during bright daylight, making it possible to expose up to several minutes or more. It can convert a bright day into night, allowing photographers to use two minute exposure time with ISO 100 and f/8 aperture during a bright day. 

The ND4000 and ND65000 have distinct advantages in having more stops than the typical ND1000 or ND32000. They allow users to avoid diffraction softening by enabling users to avoid very small aperture settings or alternatively allowing for longer exposures. In the case of the PowerND 4000 that means two more stops than the typical ND1000 and for the Power ND65000 there's one additional stop.

 

The Aurora PowerND family comes with four different formats:

Circular format for most of lenses with filter thread sizes from 37mm to 95mm 

Square format of 100 x 100 x 2mm compatible with filter holders from Cokin, Lee, and others 

Circular 150mm with adapter for Nikon AF-S 14-24/2.8G 

Aurora CR format for Canon lenses that support rear gel filter 

The CR format filter is an industry first rear mount glass format for Canon EF lenses, such as the popular EF 11-24mm F4L USM. 

The Aurora PowerND CR format filters are very small and easy to carry. Gorilla Glass is used to provide rigidity and durability for such small filter.

The CR filters come with a metal filter holder that replaces the original plastic gel filter in the Canon lens. Gel filters are optically inferior with significant deflation of resolution and have strong color cast.

All PowerND filters use the same multi-layer nano coatings techniques for both light reduction and surface protection. In order to provide accurate color reproduction and high resolution, we apply multi-layer nano coating to both sides of the the PowerND 4000 and PowerND 65000 filters. The end result is that we achieve excellent result in resolution and color rendition.

PowerND 4000 Spectrum Transmittance

As avid landscape photographers ourselves, we understand these filters are used in harsh environment, in places that could be rough, dirty, and wet. Therefore, filters should be able to repel water, oil, dust and dirt.

Static contact angle of PowerND coating

Multiple layer of nano coating technology is applied to glass surfaces. Perfluoropolyethers (PFPE) are used as hydrophobic and oleophobic coating agent. The end result is that water drop on the surface of the filter can maintain a static contact angle of 110 degrees. Untreated glass can barely maintain 15 degrees. Even a well known brand’s 10 stop filter keeps less than 40 degrees and their 6 and 15 stop filters do not even have water repel coating.

Static contact angle of Brand L (no coating)

Independent lab tests show the PowerND filters having very high resolution and color accuracy.

Well known Schott B 270® i Ultra-White Glass is used for the PowerND filters, except the CR format which employs CORNING® GORILLA® GLASS.

In order to minimize vignetting on wide angle lenses, the circular filters (37-82mm) feature a very thin filter profile of 3.4mm (not counting the thread).

The 100mm square filters conform to the industry de facto standard so they can be used in Cokin (Z), LEE 100mm, and other compatible 100mm filter holders. Both the 100mm PowerND 4000 and PowerND 65000 filters have a dense dark foam padding and paint sealing of edges to prevent light leakage during long exposure.

The adapter for the Nikon AF-S 14-24/2.8G is an original design by us. It’s simple and effective, with a felt lining inside the ring enclosure to prevent scratching the lens hood. Removable clips are included to support two 150mm square or rectangular filters.

We are very proud of our Aurora CR format adapter and filters. We take advantage of select Canon wide angle lenses have a rear mount filter holder and have designed an replacement. The original gel filter holder does not allow glass filters to be used. Gel filters typically have inferior optical characteristics than glass based ones.

The CR holders are CNC machined with utmost precision. Not only it allows glass filters to be used, they are also much stronger than the original factory built in plastic holding mechanism.

Left: Aurora CR filter, Right: 186mm front mount filter

The reason of using the rear mount filter over the front one is primary the size of filters. Based on results from simulation, if we were to make a front mount filter for the Canon EF 11-24mm F4L USM, a lens that is very popular among the Canon landscape shooters, a filter size would be at least 185mm or larger, either in circular or square format. Filters with such size are not only inconvenient to carry and use, but also expensive.

Our CR filters are slight larger than a quarter dollar US coin and easily carried around. Just like the rest of the PowerND filter family, the CR filters are coated with the same multi-layer nano coatings for both light reduction and surface protection against water, oil, dust and dirt.

Gorilla Glass® is used for the CR filters to provide rigidity and durability for this small size filter.

Canon lenses that can use the CR filters include:

EF 8-15mm f/4L Fisheye 

EF 11-24mm F4L USM 

EF 14mm f/2.8L USM 

EF 15mm f/2.8 Fisheye 

EF 16-35mm f/2.8L USM

EF 17-35mm f/2.8L USM 

EF 17-40mm f/4L USM

We also have an Aurora IR format for Irix lenses. The filters and replacement adapter are very similar to the Canon version. However, the filters and replacement adapter for the Irix lenses are not compatible with the Canon version.

Both  Irix 15mm f/2.4 and 11mm f/4.0 and three mount types (Canon EF, Nikon F, and Pentax K) are supported.

 

 

PowerND 64 (ND 1.8) - 6 stops 

PowerND 4000 (ND 3.6) - 12 stops 

PowerND 65000 (ND 4.8) - 16 stops

Available formats:

Φ37mm, Φ39mm, Φ40.5mm, Φ43mm, Φ46mm, Φ52mm, Φ55mm, Φ58mm, Φ62mm, Φ67mm, Φ72mm, Φ77mm, Φ82mm, and Φ95mm 

Φ150mm with Nikon AF-S 14-24mm f/2.8G adapter 

100 x 100 x 2mm compatible with Cokin Z, LEE and other 100mm filter holders 

Aurora CR format for Canon EF 11-24 F4L USM with adapter replacement

Aurora IR format for Irix lenses with adapter replacement

Press Kit

 

 

With so many different formats and three ND ratings, we need to simplify the offering process.

First of all, filter of the three ND rating are priced the same for the same size. Secondly, circular filters are divided into three groups:

Small: 37mm, 39mm, 40.5mm, and 43mm 

Medium: 49mm, 52mm, 55mm, 58mm, and 62mm 

Large: 67mm, 72mm, 77mm, and 82mm

Filters in the same group are priced the same.

Once the campaign is over and the funding goal is met, we will send out a survey through Kickstarter's internal system to each backer for following information:

Name and shipping address 

ND rating of the filter, e.g. ND 64, ND 4000, or ND65000 

Size of the circular filter, e.g. 77mm, or 82mm

There are also bundle options available, i.e. three ND rating (6/12/16 stops) filters of the same size. 

The Nikon AF-S 14-24mm f/2.8G bundle option includes all three filters plus a lens shade filter holder whereas the CR format is only available as a bundle option with the replacement filter holder included.

While this would simplify the ordering process, it adds additional time for us to find out exactly what size and ND rating our backers have ordered. Based on our previous crowdfunding experience, this could add three weeks or more.

If you wish to get multiple filters, you will need to manually input your pledge by adding the total amount.  

We started this project more than two years ago, even before the variable ND PowerXND project. Unfortunately we took the wrong path so we had to reboot last year to take on a new direction. With experience we learn from the PowerXND and other projects, we spent more time in field tests and we are lucky to have over a dozen beta testers from China, France, Germany, Russia, and USA. With their feedbacks based on actual using the prototypes in various locations, we are able to improve the filters.

We are confident the PowerND filters are now in production ready status. 

 

Special thanks to the beta testers who have helped us to test the PowerND filters and provided great feedback on product improvements.

story:
Introducing Amaryllo's 4th generation professional outdoor A.I. powered security camera robot that can recognize faces and tell the difference between people, cars, & even pets!

Ranked as the number-one camera robot company in the global smart home market, Amaryllo employs patented technologies to replace traditional PC-based tracking systems with embedded multi-core CPUs inside each camera. Amaryllo camera robots have artificial intelligence to recognize human faces, talk to intruders, auto-track intruders, and can even check your new email arrival. These camera robots are revolutionizing today’s home security market. Amaryllo camera robots have been employed by worldwide law enforcement.  

AR4 is designed to replace traditional CCTV which is widely used in today's homes and communities. With ever increasing security threats and burglaries, it is important to upgrade commonplace CCTV with updated technologies such that security cameras can turn themselves from passive recording devices to proactive camera robots to actively look for possible danger and furthermore, protect itself from hackers!

 

What is PoE?

  

The PoE, or Power over Ethernet is the technology that has been widely used in the network equipment which allows for power and data transmission through the same Ethernet cable eliminating the need for an extra power cable connection. The simple cabling will dramatically reduce the installation cost and time. Without the need of a centralized network equipment and heavy investment on extra software or hardware, AR4 is the most flexible, reliable and affordable object recognition robot camera in the markets to date.

 

Facial Recognition

The movie "Why Him?" uses Amaryllo facial recognition.

Product shown is Amaryllo Fairy.

 

 

Feature Highlight

 

◉  Patented Fast Facial Recognition – Amaryllo AI needs only one picture to learn your face. Face recognition will be improved through continuous learning in Amaryllo's intuitive APP. Once detected, Amaryllo server will dispatch recognition alerts to owners in seconds. It is the most effective security protection today.  

Face Recognition - faces recognizable within 12 feet (3.5 meters) 

Unknown - if faces are not registered 

Continuous Learning - one face will be good to get started but more the better  

 

◉  Intelligent AI Recognition – AR4X and AR3S PRO can detect human bodies over 40 feet and cars over 60 feet away. If uninvited guest or vehicle intrudes the house owner’s property, Amaryllo cameras will send a crucial alert to the house owners instantly. This useful new upgrade will significantly reduce false alarm and is free under paid Amaryllo cloud subscription plans. 

Human Detection - recognize human over 40 feet (12 meters)  

Smart Recognition - recognize human body not just faces  

Night Vision - can recognize human even in dark environment

  

Vehicle Detection - recognize cars over 60 feet (20 meters)  

Multiple Detection - recognize over 100 faces and human at the same time   

Moving Recognition - detect faces and human bodies even at movement  

Demo test - installed in the largest electronics store  

Headcount and human recognition - assist store in data mining  

 

◉  World's Best Encryption – Amaryllo employs the world's toughest military security-level 256-bit encryption technologies to offer the best privacy protection for its users. Take a look at the video below for a quick explanation video! 

 

◉  On-Screen Multi-Channel viewing and Control  – Stream up to 9 cameras in the APP and control all of the live streaming right beneath your fingertip! 

Multi-camera feed in one screen (4 channel view) 

(3 channel view) 

 

◉  On Screen Video Timeline Playback – Remotely access the internal memory of the camera by simply swipe on the Timeline feature. Review recorded videos and alerts at anywhere at any time. 

 

◉  Activity or Blockout Zones – Flexible monitor allows you to designat areas to be monitors or to be ignored.

 

◉   Real-Time 360 Auto-Tracking – With embedded multi-core CPUs AR3S is able to perform real-time video analytics so it can track intruders over 40 feet (12 meters) without a remote PC. *Available with AR3S model only

AR3S auto-track demo in a lake house property in Atlanta, USA

 

◉  Talk and Listen – When it is not enough to just see what is going on, AR3S's built-in microphone and speaker allows you conduct real-time communication and furthermore, the 10-second video alerts capture not just video but sound too!  *Available with AR3S model only

Advanced waterproof speakers and microphone

Capture with great details!

 

◉  Professional Outdoor IP66 Grade – AR3S Plus and AR4 are designed with industry grade parts and are fully certified for IP66 anti-dust / anti-water grade. Both models are built to withstand outdoor elements with an operating temperature range from -20°F to 120°F (-30°C to 50°C).

Wide industry grade temperature ranges

 

◉  Free 3 day snapshot alert storage – Snapshot alerts for rolling 3 days so you can always go back to see what happened in the past 72 hours!

 

◉  Smart Watch Support – AR4 and AR3S Plus are compatible with the most popular smart watches such as Apple Watch and Pebble. Alert messages can be pushed to your smart watch so you are always alerted should the camera detects abnormal activity in your property.

 

 

What is Amaryllo Service

Amaryllo Cloud is not just a very cost-efficient and convenient way to store your videos, it also comes with extra AI features currently unseen in the market to date! Best of all 1 subscription plan covers up to 4 cameras at fix cost! 

 

A Closer Look!

Housed in a high-quality aluminum casing to operate in extreme high-temperature environment, AR4 is implemented with industry grade components to survive in wide outdoor temperature range from -20F to 120F (-20C to 50C). This enables AR4 to virtually work in harsh conditions on Earth!

 

AR4 for Home and Business

Remote facilities. Shops. Warehouses. Offices. Whatever the business, AR4 has you covered!

 

Or use one for your business establishment!

The wiring process can’t be simpler for DIY enthusiasts.

AR4 is the most scalable solution where you can add more cameras later on! When choosing between PoE Switch, please note the PoE switch ports used for AR4 model support IEEE 802.3 af/at and the switch for AR3S supports IEEE 802.3at.  

(Please also note that the products are not intended for submersion in water. Installation in a sheltered location is recommended and PoE Switch and RJ45 cables are not included.) 

 

Smart Home Integration

 

Amaryllo camera robots are now integrated into ASUS's smart home automation. 

 

Awards and Recognitions

Ranked as the worldwide number-one camera robot company by Gartner, Amaryllo is the proud winner of CES Best of Innovations under the Embedded Technology category for four consecutive years (2015-2018). Amaryllo competed with 17 countries and won the 16th APICTA (Asia Pacific ICT Alliance Awards) top Gold International Award under security category and was recognized for ‘Best Product of the Year’ awarded by Mobile and Digital Forum in Moscow, Russia and The Security Show in Sydney, Australia. 

 

Interviewed by CBS at CES 2017 

Interviewed by a German TV at IFA 2017 

Interviewed by a Romania TV at IFA 2017 

 

 

Perks Overview

9

Shipping cost is USD $20 for a single unit of AR4 and $40 of AR4X (4 units) 

VAT is not included

For more information about the CES 2017 award-winning AR3S please visit: www.amaryllo.eu/n60104/prod_ar3s/

or 

Check out the successful AR3S campaign here

 

Campaign Time Line

 

Design Process

PCBA Module of AR4

The evolution of AR4

Assembly of AR4 Prototype

 

Risk and Challenges

This year will be our 3rd crowdfunding campaign and thanks to all of our supporters,  we were able to fulfill the project and deliver every single perk. Building a new kind of robotic camera solution is a complex and time-consuming task. We are humble to the challenges and know that there will many obstacles to overcome but we are determined to bring products to market and have a skillful team to do so.  

 

Amaryllo in the News 

 

General Enquiry: campaign.ai@amaryllo.eu 

Website:  http://www.amaryllo.eu/

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCo0m8Z02ENQKKnDPFkW-eUA 

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Amaryllo-International-BV/140166509485791

Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amaryllo

story:
Introducing Micro and Magnum; V2 of the Universal Lens Cap. 

Truly a universal, durable and functional product backed by a lifetime warranty from the company that has set out to keeping your photography gear KUVRD (‘covered’).

Lifetime Replacement Warranty

The Universal Lens Cap does have a warranty. In fact, a lifetime warranty! For as long as you own the product, you are 100% insured against defects in material and workmanship. 

However, we do NOT provide a warranty against damage or any other defects/issues caused to your lenses WHILE using or NOT using the Universal Lens Cap. In addition, we will not replace lost or stolen Universal Lens Caps.

If your lens breaks while using our product, we are not liable for your camera gear, its repair/replacement, nor act as a financial insurance agency against potentially harmful issues to your camera equipment, especially your lenses. The Universal Lens Cap acts as an aversion tool to mother nature and potentially harmful elements. That is it. We strongly advise you seek out and invest in insurance for your gear just as any other professional would do in any other industry! :)

Customs & Duties

Unfortunately, we cannot mark any pledge/reward as a 'gift'. It is illegal to do so. In addition, import duties and taxes are NOT INCLUDED in our reward levels. These charges vary by country and are completely out of our control. We are shipping the Universal Lens Cap all over the world and it is impossible for us to build the various customs charges into the various reward levels of Kickstarter.

But, this online tool can help you calculate additional costs;

http://www.importcalculator.com

Remember, we are the creators of KUVRD and the Universal Lens Cap, not international customs. You can use this tool as estimates when determining additional costs in receiving our products.

30-Day Money Back Guarantee 

As stated in our warranty section, we will happily replace the ULC for any defects in material and/or workmanship. 

We also provide a 30-Day Money Back Guarantee Policy. If you're unsatisfied with the Universal Lens Cap for any reason - within the first 30 days of receiving the Universal Lens Cap - we'll send you a full refund. We're not here to take advantage of our backers nor exploit their belief in us by sending them something they weren't expecting with the ULCII.

Just remember, every dollar from this campaign will be directly used to paying off mold fees, patent fees, initial start-up costs, actually producing the lens caps, producing the packaging, fulfilling those orders and paying off all other expenses incurred thus far.

Risks and Challenges

Our biggest foreseeable challenge will be properly calculating, negotiating, and fixating costs and pricing with manufacturers for materials. Silicone is a rather volatile material, where, based on municipal laws, seasons and other related material-based industries, much of the cost of material used in the Universal Lens Cap can almost double overnight thanks to some shift or change in one of those aforementioned factors.

Luckily, we've already made a Purchase Order for 25,000 of the ULCII and fulfilled most of our Kickstarter Orders from just a couple months ago! Hopefully if we need to make another PO for this Campaign, based on the demand and current pricing of silicone, we'll be able to fixate or even decrease the unit cost!

Our second biggest challenge is determining a realistic 'estimated date of delivery'. Based on our history with our current chosen manufacturers, we can have a unit created and in our hands within 45 days. Taking into account holidays, quantity of units, priority of our order with the manufacturer and shipping to customers worldwide, we gave ourselves a buffer of an additional 60 days to handle any 'hiccups' throughout the process.

There are always unforeseeable risks, setbacks and hiccups which is why we plan to be transparent and do everything we can to keep our customers (you, the backer) happy.

story:
Short Summary

Out of tragedy will come beauty. On September 18, 2013, all of my possessions were stolen and I was left with nothing. Literally nothing. Among the stolen items was my Canon 40D DSLR camera body, and 4 L-series Canon lenses. It was more than just camera gear. It was my livelihood. As I found myself penniless and possessionless, I was given one of the greatest gifts... the ability to rebuild smarter and better. Gone were all the creative projects I had done up to date. Gone were the back ups. But I was left with an overwhelming desire to make something beautiful out of the utter devastation that struck my life.

Now I am embarking on a great journey to produce travel guides to many of the worlds best kept secrets and a few of the known gems. More than just a book of what to do and where to stay, this series is built on the premise that by sharing the stories of the people that call these places home and by capturing images that depict the soul of the city, readers can be transported to a different place just by flipping the pages of a book. And if they do travel to one of the locations, they will have a glimpse into their new environment that was previously impossible simply by booking a hotel and dining out each night.

This series is designed to tell the story of a city, by telling the story of those that call it home. What makes them tick. What inspires them. What do they have in common with us all. What are their dreams. It's part travelogue, part memoir. It's meant to make a future trip more magnificent and take readers that can't travel on mental journey to the far reaches of the Earth.

What I Need & What You Get

Here it is in simple terms:

  • I have a pen, I have paper, but I have no camera equipment. The funds will go towards purchasing camera gear to take professional pictures. A camera body similar to the one I had is roughly $1,100. And a basic lens that is high quality (able to shoot in most lighting situations) is $300. A backup battery and memory card adds on a few extra hundred dollars.
  • This is the only missing element to make the travel guide series a reality. Every donation will help - no matter how small. It will all get me one step closer towards being able to work professionally again. If the entire goal is not reached... The funds will be used to either rent gear to produce one book in the series of travel books, or purchase a camera model slightly less expensive (and significantly less versatile).
  • On the rare chance that only $20 or $40 is raised. The money used will be put towards purchasing lenses that are used on the iPhone and take pictures with the camera on the phone. No matter what, someone can take my possessions, but they can't take my drive to create or my desire to make beautiful artistic expressions that enhance the lives of those around me.
  • This is one of those projects where the perks are never ending. Every donor will have the option of being included on my "forever thankful" list. To those that are one the list. I will forever offer free photos/prints - special personalized cards for holidays - advanced copies of future books - and even customized work in the future. Aside from the perks listed in this campaign. Those that help give me the gift of work and allow me to earn a living again will have my gratitude forever and will always be able to get prints, photo sessions, poems or anything else I ever create. For without you, there would be no me.

The Impact

I have always given back to the community. While living in Idaho, I took family photos of homeless people living in the region and printed them out for them to keep. This small gift was meant to inspire the most vulnerable when they needed it the most. The idea was that a homeless man could pull out the photo of his family and get the inspiration he needed to continue looking for work, or remember why he needed to live.

I have always worked within all budgets. I always felt that great photos should be accessible by all people. So I operated with a sliding scale. I barter, and once even accepted a "Thank You" as paid in full.

The donations on here will not be taken for granted. I have lost everything. But I was also given more motivation than I knew possible. This travel series will be an inspiration, an interesting read and may just open the eyes of folks to the world around them.

Your contributions now will help me dedicate my life to making the world around me a better place and adding beauty in everything I do.

Every gift will be rewarded with a copy of the first book in the series centered around Cartegena, Colombia. In addition, I will be offering prints and additional photos, along with discounts on other books.

Have a photographic need? Don't live in Florida? I will be giving away music lessons via Skype, tutoring in English, editing for students' essays, free inspirational mugs, coasters, key chains and greeting cards, and a host of other offerings from a truly grateful author and photographer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share links to the campaign on your Facebook, Twitter and Google+ pages.
  • Tell your friends and family about the fundraiser.
  • Share the fundraiser and my personal story with your church group.
  • Help spread the word to anyone that will listen.
  • Offer a word of encouragement and drop me a note.

And that's all there is to it.

In addition, I will be offering prints and additional photos, along with discounts on other books.Have a photographic need? Don't live in Florida? I will be giving away music lessons via Skype, tutoring in English, editing for students' essays, free inspirational mugs, coasters, key chains and greeting cards, and a host of other offerings from a truly grateful author and photographer.Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Share links to the campaign on your Facebook, Twitter and Google+ pages.
Tell your friends and family about the fundraiser.
Share the fundraiser and my personal story with your church group.
Help spread the word to anyone that will listen.
Offer a word of encouragement and drop me a note.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Story of Hangbeam

There are millions of tablets out there with no lighting for the front facing camera. We've done all we can to create a solution to an annoying problem, bad light when video chatting on your tablet computer.  Even with most cell phones having front facing cameras, often times the way we look to ourselves discourages us from engaging in a video chat because we just don't look our best. Now there is a solution.

Hangbeam is a compact and convenient, battery powered device that works with virtually any tablet computer such as an iPad, Nexus or Surface tablet.  It sits over the edge of the device and can even work with your laptop computer as well! It provides a warm, flattering glow of light that looks great amongst a broad range of skin tones.

Arriving at this product was an arduous process and we have made it this far because:

  • The Hangbeam team is made up of me, an industrial process engineer and my partner who handles the web and the business end.
  • We decided to launch the project on IndieGoGo because we like the social impact IndieGoGo is making, allowing small projects to have an explosive impact.
  • With the support of IndieGoGo supporters, we will not only be able to get products out in the hands of great techies, but we'll actually be able to finally launch the business offering a series of cool innovations to consumers.

Make the most of your mobile device and get the right light, we're sure it will make all of the difference in your picture taking at dinner, and especially when video chatting if you're in a long distance relationship, overseas friends and family, military families and loved service members abroad, distance learning, consultants, bloggers and Internet content providers everywhere.

It also makes a great gift!  We will happily provide digital vouchers to those who are giving a Hangbeam as a gift just so they know you're thinking of that special someone.

We need 1,000 Hangbeams pledged

Current manufacturing start-up costs are expensive and complex, especially when electronics are concerned. So in order for us to get up and running at a cost that makes sense for supporters, we need a minimum of 1,000 units in the hands of supporters.

  • $40,000 is what we need to get the final engineering, tooling, customized electoronic switches and led lighting made and assembled to bring a Hangbeam into the hands of users.  We have a lineup of manufacturers already qualified and proven to be able to get to work as soon as we get funded.
  • All units will be manufactured here in the USA to begin with.  We cannot guarantee this to be the case in the future, so if you'd like to own a Made In The U.S.A. product and innovation, support Hangbeam!

The MSRP or full retail price of Hangbeam in stores is pegged at $59.95 due to the high quality materials and finish we've put into it.  At that price, it would be a real value considering many cell phone cases cost about that, have no electronics in them and are made completely out of plastic.  So, we're ready to get people excited about a product that will encourage you to video chat and take pictures in places you didn't think of before, by getting early supporters a great price for trusting in us.

Hangbeam can be yours for only $39 over 33% off! Save more by getting a Couples Kit and get a set of two for only $70 shipped to a single address.

If for some reason we do not reach the $40,000 sales mark, but come close, we will still be able to deliver on the units supporters have committed to, but, production will take an additional 6 weeks due to the need for us to have tooling made overseas, instead of right here in America.

Be Among The First

Your contribution and participation makes a big difference because every unit that is being manufactured is the result of hard work of a serious two man team bringing a product into the market.  We both have experience and successes in the digital world creating and building apps, web-based software, as well as computer solutions for industry.  Now is your opportunity to support a ground floor innovation that we feel confident has a genuine appeal to the mobile technology market. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to support us, but do not video chat, take pictures with your mobile device or own one, you can still help us!  Just LIKE us on Facebook by clicking LIKE here: https://www.facebook.com/Hangbeam

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remember that we encourage you to put the Indiegogo share tools to work and drive traffic our way to support the Hangbeam project!

 

Hangbeam has already been granted and issued a registered trademark by the US Patent and Trademark Office and is currently under a provisional patent and is Patent Pending.

Hangbeam is not affiliated or associated with Apple, Microsoft, Google or any of their affiliated companies.  HANGBEAM 2013 All rights reserved.

story:
THANK    YOU

 

YOU ARE ESSENTIAL TO EVERY STEP WE MOVE FORWARD, CAMPAIGN IS CLOSED, BUT THE JOURNEY IS ON, YOU CAN STILL KEEP FOLLOWING PILOT ERA ON                                                                                 

                                                          www.pisofttech.com

 

 

The problem with most current 360° cameras is the image quality is too low and the video produced is blurry when viewed in VR headsets. Or, the camera is too big and has a cumbersome workflow which requires a powerful and expensive computer to process files, with long wait times. With Pilot Era, these problems are solved. 

By packing a touch screen, Android OS and other top-grade hardware into a compact body no bigger than your hand, Pilot Era is the world's first true all-in-one solution 8K 360° VR camera. 100% in-camera stitching means you can produce beautiful 8K videos or images ready to upload without any computer processing. Balanced colors with frame and exposure synchronization bring razor-sharp details for your 8K 360° content. Transport your audience into your world with just a simple tap on the touchscreen!


 




Pilot Era Reviews:     360 Rumors     |      Alchimista Blog

Check demo video to learn about the in-camera operation of Pilot Era!

 



 


Pilot Era has a high-definition touch screen and user-friendly operating system that almost feels like a mobile phone. While you have the option to connect using our Pilot Go mobile App, we make it easy for you to do everything, including stitching, previewing, publishing, and adjusting settings, by simply using just the Pilot Era as an all-in-one standalone device without your phone or computer.

Pilot Era uses top-class hardware and carefully optimized in-camera stitching algorithms, so that you can enjoy extremely sharp details in every frame of 8K 360° videos and images.


 

Unlike every other product on the market, Pilot Era does not require any post-processing on a PC. It shoots up to 8K resolution panoramic videos and photos and automatically stitches them inside the camera. Pilot Era saves you more time, and makes your 8K panorama content creation more efficient!

With both wired ethernet and wireless 4G cellular/dual-band Wi-Fi connection, Pilot Era is able to stream 4K panoramic content through its built-in server or custom server without any computer. Log into your account, one-click stream to Facebook/YouTube/other live platforms, and share wonderful moments with friends! Of course, simultaneous live-streaming and recording is supported. 


Pilot Era is carefully optimized for street view photographers. Being a GSV ready camera, it has built-in ultra-precise GPS, supports one-click upload to Google Maps and creating native Google Street View with blue lines on the map! GSV photography has never been easier! 


Pilot OS is customized from Android OS, and supports OTA upgrades. We are constantly refining and improving the camera's software to enhance its performance and expand its features. Moreover, you have the capacity to use different peripherals through its full-function USB-C interface, such as displays, microphones and power banks.

We have been listening to our users all the time, and now provide you with new features:



Pilot Era is a professional 360° VR camera. Its large aperture aspherical fisheye lenses and professional-grade sensors accurately capture every wonderful moment. Real-time stitching and optical flow stitching allow you to shoot high-quality images in all conditions. Plus, multi-lens color balance and frame synchronization let you create the most flawless videos or photos anytime, anywhere. 

Loaded with 512GB UFS high-speed storage, Pilot Era stores over 6.5 hours of 8K videos or 26000 panoramic photos. 

 

Pilot Era comes with advanced 9-axis gyroscope, which brings outstanding stabilization. It doesn't require post-processing and achieves perfect stabilization just in the camera. This will give you the highest guarantee whether for outdoor live streaming or video recording.

 

Through Pilot Era's built-in touch screen, you can preview everything in real-time and tweak various professional settings for the best effect of photos and videos, including high dynamic range, white balance, exposure and so on.

With a huge 7200mAh removable high capacity battery, Pilot Era can shoot up to 3.5 hours of 8K videos - this is the longest battery life of any 360° camera on the market.

 

The Pilot Era weighs 690g and has a highly compact structure that is even smaller than a beer can. As the smallest 8K professional 360° camera on the market, it fits in any bag or backpack.


 



 

 





And check the 360° photos below:



 




 


 

Pisofttech was founded in 2012 by the Alumnus of Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. As one of the earliest groups participated in research and development of embedded panoramic algorithms in China, Pisofttech focuses on image and graphics fusion algorithms and visual products. Moreover, Pisofttech is the only panoramic DSP algorithms provider of CEVA - the leading DSP company.

As the largest panoramic algorithms solution provider on the market, we secured investment from renowned investors including SummitView Capital, ARM China Early Investment Fund, China Resources and Leaguer.

 


 

Since the birth of the team, we have been focusing on the field of panoramic algorithms. After long-term efforts, we have become the panoramic DSP algorithm supplier of CEVA.

Through several years of investigation into the panoramic camera industry, we found that all of the professional-grade 8K panoramic cameras on the market have several common shortcomings like large size, complicated operation/UX, cumbersome workflow and requirement for very expensive computers for post-processing, with a steep learning curve for the user. 

If there is a panoramic camera that can shoot, stitch, upload and share high-quality 8K videos and photos all in the camera, and completely get rid of post-processing on the computer, the time and cost of 8K panorama production will be greatly reduced , so that a lot more people can easily create astonishing professional-level panoramic works. That’s why we start the Pilot Era project!

Our outstanding engineers has spent nearly two years on the design and development of the Pilot Era. During this period, we have successfully overcome a lot of technical obstacles, such as: 8K in-camera stitching algorithms, frame synchronization and multi-lens color balance, etc. Thanks to their hard work, we finally realized the first round of production of Pilot Era in October 2018.


 


 



For more return and refund policies, please refer to our after-sales details here.

 



It’s essential to note that we have already finished the camera and have done a successful round of mass production; unlike some crowdfunding campaigns, this hardware is already fully verified and in production. Additionally, we have solid financial backing and are a fully functioning and well-staffed company already for many years.

As a leading panoramic algorithms provider in the world, we have the most extensive industry experience in firmware development for panoramic cameras, having supplied many other hardware companies with expertise in algorithms and implementation for 360° cameras. At present, we have completed all the research and development work of Pilot Era, and in October last year we have realized the first small batch production. 

With our strong supply chain team, we believe that we can minimise almost all the potential risks in this journey. However, as any other hardware products, the unexpected delays related to manufacturing and production may occur. If there is any obstacle, we will definitely keep you in the loop. Due to different countries' laws and regulations of custom duty, there are chances that backers need to pay custom duty. 

With your great support and our efforts, we believe that we will be able to deliver the Pilot Era on time and exceeding all of your expectations.
