story:
Short Summary

A desperate financial situation leads Flynn, an alien exterminator, to follow a distress call from a posh planet full of sycophants. When Flynn learns that the people's minds have also been invaded, Flynn is stranded and running out of options. He must choose to save the survivors, or escape. 

FATL is a 52 page graphic novel.

 

 

Features

FATL is a 52-page graphic novel.

 

 

Stretch Goals

$40,000 - Added fan art pages in the book. Enter to be included by creating an ad for Flynn's Alien Termination service and email your submission to sweetcastclint@gmail.com. 2 winners will receive $100 gift cards and have their ad included in the fan art section.

$50,000 - Everyone get an 11 x 17 fold-out poster!

$60,000 - Added sketch and development pages. This increases the total page count to 64 pages!

$70,000 - Upgraded print quality. Thicker paper, thicker cover, and a matte finish.

$75,000 - Collector Bundle backers get a signed bookplate. Every backer gets a bookmark and sticker.

$80,000 - Everyone gets a trading card!

 

Risks & Challenges

We are professionals. This is Clint's third graphic novel campaign, and Charlie Snogans is a top-tier professional artist. You will get your books.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please SHARE this campaign with your friends, family, and complete strangers on the street. We really appreciate your support!

story:
“LADY ALCHEMY: MUTUS LIBER”

Lady Alchemy, a performer in NYC wants to become a star, but after an altercation in a NYC alley after her performance, Lady Alchemy goes on a journey find out why. She meets an old man named William in an old book store who gives her an ancient alchemical text, the Mutus Liber, and helps her to understand the formula for transmutation to perfect her soul. 

With your help we can tell her story and the story of the unseen forces that rule the world. Lets  bring back powerful feminine beauty of 90s comic book babes. 

 

This story is based off of my real life story as a performer in nyc, dealing with all sorts of evils in the entertainment world. 

 

This is where she goes to feel at peace again and dream. Above the city. Above it all.

 

backstage at the nightclub

 

Lady Alchemy performs "Fallen Angel" 

 

A deal of a lifetime

 

meeting William at the Cloak & Codex book store where he gives her the 'Mutus Liber'

 

Performing for the elites on a special occasion

 

More than just a performance

 

As Above, So Below

Colorist mood board based on the REAL Lady Alchemy performances.

 

some close-up coloring of Lady Alchemy's Fallen Angel Performance

 

STRETCH GOALS

$40,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED* - fixing the mess that was created 

$60,000 STRETCH GOAL *LOCKED* - 6-page mini book of Lady Alchemy performances

story:
USAssassin returns in his deadliest adventure! 

Project: USAssassin is reborn, as agent Joe Knight is assigned an all-new team to lead against the world's greatest threat, Graveyard Shift! Featuring the first appearance of professional wrestling superstar, "The Mercenary" Flip Gordon.

Writer, Mark Poulton (Graveyard Shift, SeaDog, USAssassin, Viking Wolf) and Mike McMahon have their USAssassin take on Poulton & Jon Malin's Graveyard Shift in this 54 page, high octane graphic novel. They are joined by Graveyard Shift's colorist, Anthony George, and letterer, Eric Weathers for this pulse pounding adventure! Covers by McMahon and Matt Martin (Snowman). 

Standard Cover by Mike McMahon and Anthony George. 

 

Blood Bath Variant Cover by Matt Martin and Anthony George.

 

Book III Photo Cover featuring "The Mercenary" Flip Gordon. 

 

 

Black & White Edition

Art lovers can enjoy this volume in the new Black & White Edition too featuring a cover by Eric Weathers (Battle Brick Road). 

Cover by Eric Weathers.

 

Interior pages by Mike McMahon. 

 

First Appearance of "The Mercenary" Flip Gordon

Pro Wrestling's "The Mercenary" Flip Gordon makes his USAssassin debut, as the newest recruit to the USAssassin team. Can he be trusted? Not only does he appear in the main book, but you can enhance your reading experience by picking up the The Mercenary/Bazooka Dog 20 page flipbook, where you'll learn The Mercenary's whereabouts prior to this volume! The Mercenary story is by Poulton and McMahon, while the Bazooka Dog tale is by Mark & Chase Poulton (Lil Graveyard Shift, SeaDog) with art by Renzo Rodriguez (Impossible Stars, Viking Wolf). 

The Mercenary Foil Cover by Renzo Rodriguez and Anthony George.

 

The Mercenary interior page by Mike McMahon, Andrew Mangum and Anthony George. 

 

Bazooka Dog Foil Cover by Mark Poulton, Chase Poulton and Anthony George. 

 

Bazooka Dog interior page by Renzo Rodriguez & Anthony George.

 

Collected Edition I

If you're new to the USAssassin storyline, you can get caught up in this affordable 120+ page collected edition featuring volumes 1 & 2 with an all-new cover by Aaron Alfeche (Jawbreakers, Graveyard Shift). 

Collected Edition Cover by Aaron Alfeche and Anthony George. 

 

Collector's Case

The USAssassin Collector's Case tradition continues in this special "The Mercenary" Edition. Backers of this tier will get both Mike McMahon's and Matt Martin's cover to Volume III, the Black & White Edition, the Mercenary/Bazooka Dog flipbook, Collected Edition I, and for the first time ever Mark Poulton is releasing a Scriptbook that is included in the Collector's Case! 6 total books plus a print signed by pro wrestler, "The Mercenary" Flip Gordon and a sketch by Mike McMahon inside this gorgeous case! 

Collector's Case art by Mike McMahon and Anthony George. 

 

USAssassin Script Book Wraparound Foil Cover by Andrew Mangum and Anthony George. 

 

Become A Member of Steelforce! 

Become a part of the action when you're drawn into the upcoming Volume 4: Dogs Of War graphic novel as a member of Sensei Steel's new trainees, Steelforce! Not only do you get drawn into the next volume, you'll receive all 6 books from the campaign, the signed Flip Gordon print, sketch by Mike McMahon, plus this awesome custom USAssassin: Steelforce Collector's Case made from an old military ammo can! Limited to only 5 backers! 

Free Mini-Figure To First 100 Backers! 

Bring home the Moral Compass with this all-new variant mini-figure. The man who fulfilled five comic book campaigns in a single year is available in miniature plastic! This time he's wearing the USAssassin/Graveyard Shift shirt and holding a brick replica of USAssassin Volume 1. Limited to the first 100 backers! 

Stretch Goals! 

  • $5,000 - Foil Trading Card of USAssassin vs Vlad by Ced Nocon. 
  • $10,000 - The Mercenary Trading Card by Mike McMahon. 
  • $15,000 - 6 x 9 team print by Renzo Rodriguez. 
  • $20,000 - Slither vs Mick The Monster Mayhew trading card. 
  • $25,000 - House of Ghosts Ashcan Preview.
  • $30,000 - 6 x 9 print of Mercenary & Lilith by Eric Weathers.
  • $35,000 - Sensei Steel Trading Card by Mike McMahon. 
  • $40,000 - Special USAssassin Team-Up 6x9 Print.

TEAM

CREATOR/WRITER/ARTIST:  STEFANI  RENNEE  

CO-WRITER: REDSMITH

COLORIST: STEFANI RENNEE

EDITOR: STEFANI RENNEE

WHAT YOU GET:

A high quality graphic novel.

Constant update, here, You Tube, Facebook and Twitter.

100% Entertainment. 

About STEFANI RENNEE

STEFANI RENNEE, Brazillian born comic book Artist/Colorist.  

 Ant (Arcana Studio), was my first job.  2005 Harvey Award Nominee (Best colorist) for Ant 

Later I started to work for DC Comics, Marvel, and other publishers as; Dark Horse, IDW, and AfterShock.

HUGE fan of Ethan Van Sciver, S.Bisley, F.Miller, M.Silvertri, Jim Lee, G.Capullo, Dale Keown, Gary Frank

story:
Dear friends,

It is time for our 12th Zagor graphic novel! Each of our Zagor books is a complete story, and this 530 page, full-color book actually contains two full stories!

When created back in 1961 In Italy and published by Sergio Bonelli Editore, Zagor was a series quite ahead of its time, as it mixes various genre: western, adventure, sci-fi, fantasy and horror. Now if you are counting the years then you may notice that this year marks Zagor’s 60th year anniversary that the very first Zagor story was published in Italy and we keep on celebrating this momentous occasion, with the unique book such as this one. Although over the years Zagor has been published in Italy, France, Croatia, Serbia, Brazil, Turkey, Greece etc., and has millions of fans across the globe, we (Epicenter Comics) were the first company to bring this international hero in English language. It's a fact that we have always held as a special honor!

 

This book

Zagor: Shadow of the Vampire, contains two stories featuring one of Zagor's greatest enemies ever, Baron Rakosi, the vampire! The first story here was created by the duo who created Zagor, writer/publisher Sergio Bonelli (under his pseudonym, Guido Nolitta) and the artist Gallieno Ferri. The second story was written by Alfredo Castelli, the creator of Martin Mystere series and writer of our previous Zagor book, The Great Conspiracy, and is drawn by the same legendary artist, Gallieno Ferri. Both stories feature elements from classical vampire books and movies, but are filtered through that unmistakable "Zagor filter," and are true to the series and the character. Actually, both of the stories are some of the all-time fan favorites!

 

This book will be 6” x 9” paperback with 530 full-color pages printed on a glossy 128 gsm paper. It will be offered in three versions, with new, main cover by Michele Rubini and colored by Well-Bee and also two classic cover by Gallieno Ferri, first of which is from the first story, "Anguish," which happens to be, by most surveys of Italian Zagor fans, the most beloved Zagor cover of all time! And time it is colored by amazing Well-Bee, using the raw scan of Ferri's black and white original, as I've always felt that the color of the old version was lacking. Our third cover is from the second story,  and we call it here "Return" cover. 

Here are some preview pages from the book:

Your pledge to this project will cover most of the printing costs of this book.

Shipping will be free in the U.S. and we have been able to secure very low shipping rates for Italy, Croatia, Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina. If this project is funded, the books will ship in early to mid December of 2021.

 

Perks

Three book versions:

Rubini's cover version

 

Ferri's "Anguish" cover version

 

Ferri's "Return" cover version:

 

Other rewards

In the Add-ons section next to each Reward you will find some of our other books from Zagor, Tex, Dylan Dog, Magic Wind, Dragonero, Entropy etc. to help you explore and also complete your collection. And there is also Whole Epicenter Comics Zagor Collection for those who are completely new.

 

The stretch goals

For this Zagor book, so far we have two stretch goals planned:

First Stretch Goal of $8500, which would unlock the special gifts for all the book pledgers:

-a set of three Zagor 5" x 7" postcards

 

Second stretch goal of $9000, which would unlock the other special gift for all the pledgers:

-two sided 8" x 12" Zagor glossy poster 

-two sided Zagor bookmark

If needed, we will announce additional stretch goals.

 

Thank you for your support and for being an essential part of this project!

Sincerely,

 

Igor Maricic

Publisher, Epicenter Comics
story_txt: Dear friends,It is time for our 12th Zagor graphic novel! Each of our Zagor books is a complete story, and this 530 page, full-color book actually contains two full stories!When created back in 1961 In Italy and published by Sergio Bonelli Editore, Zagor was a series quite ahead of its time, as it mixes various genre: western, adventure, sci-fi, fantasy and horror. Now if you are counting the years then you may notice that this year marks Zagor’s 60th year anniversary that the very first Zagor story was published in Italy and we keep on celebrating this momentous occasion, with the unique book such as this one. Although over the years Zagor has been published in Italy, France, Croatia, Serbia, Brazil, Turkey, Greece etc., and has millions of fans across the globe, we (Epicenter Comics) were the first company to bring this international hero in English language. It's a fact that we have always held as a special honor! This bookZagor: Shadow of the Vampire, contains two stories featuring one of Zagor's greatest enemies ever, Baron Rakosi, the vampire! The first story here was created by the duo who created Zagor, writer/publisher Sergio Bonelli (under his pseudonym, Guido Nolitta) and the artist Gallieno Ferri. The second story was written by Alfredo Castelli, the creator of Martin Mystere series and writer of our previous Zagor book, The Great Conspiracy, and is drawn by the same legendary artist, Gallieno Ferri. Both stories feature elements from classical vampire books and movies, but are filtered through that unmistakable "Zagor filter," and are true to the series and the character. Actually, both of the stories are some of the all-time fan favorites! This book will be 6” x 9” paperback with 530 full-color pages printed on a glossy 128 gsm paper. It will be offered in three versions, with new, main cover by Michele Rubini and colored by Well-Bee and also two classic cover by Gallieno Ferri, first of which is from the first story, "Anguish," which happens to be, by most surveys of Italian Zagor fans, the most beloved Zagor cover of all time! And time it is colored by amazing Well-Bee, using the raw scan of Ferri's black and white original, as I've always felt that the color of the old version was lacking. Our third cover is from the second story,  and we call it here "Return" cover. Here are some preview pages from the book:Your pledge to this project will cover most of the printing costs of this book.Shipping will be free in the U.S. and we have been able to secure very low shipping rates for Italy, Croatia, Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina. If this project is funded, the books will ship in early to mid December of 2021. PerksThree book versions:Rubini's cover version Ferri's "Anguish" cover version Ferri's "Return" cover version: Other rewardsIn the Add-ons section next to each Reward you will find some of our other books from Zagor, Tex, Dylan Dog, Magic Wind, Dragonero, Entropy etc. to help you explore and also complete your collection. And there is also Whole Epicenter Comics Zagor Collection for those who are completely new. The stretch goalsFor this Zagor book, so far we have two stretch goals planned:First Stretch Goal of $8500, which would unlock the special gifts for all the book pledgers:-a set of three Zagor 5" x 7" postcards Second stretch goal of $9000, which would unlock the other special gift for all the pledgers:-two sided 8" x 12" Zagor glossy poster -two sided Zagor bookmarkIf needed, we will announce additional stretch goals. Thank you for your support and for being an essential part of this project!Sincerely, Igor MaricicPublisher, Epicenter Comics

story:
Declassified: Overview

Dr. Alpha: Miracle Child: 112 page comic.

Lady Midnight (included in all tiers): 10 pages + pin-up.

The New Kid Side Story: 8 Pages

One Page Stories Suggested by very generous backers: 2 Pages

TOTAL: 131 Pages for EVERY tier.

Author Commentary (Hard Cover Only): 10 Pages

TOTAL: 141 Pages for Hard Cover Backers

Plus extras!

New free poster has been added to every perk with a physical copy of Dr. Alpha: Miracle Child!

New free bookmark added to every perk with a physical copy!

Looking for more complex characters and a more complex story set in a superhero universe?

What would happen if Fight Club's Tyler Durden became an evil scientist? Dr. Alpha has been considered as one of the most dangerous supervillains in the galaxy for decades. Now his former arch-nemesis, the Superhero known as Glorious suggests a team-up when another supervillain the Martian Mastermind returns from the dead to launch another invasion of Earth. But as everyone knows, when evil geniuses get involved, things are rarely how they appear.

Inspired by the legacy of Alan Moore's Watchmen and The Killing Joke combined with the ruthless pulp style of Frank Miller - Dr. Alpha: Miracle Child is a fast-paced, action-packed story that paints itself with shameless superhero cliche before taking a sharp turn into tragic human drama.

Enter a world without status quo. Where anything can happen. Where even the mightest superhero can't always walk away without a scar if they manage to walk away at all.

WARNING: Due to some of the events that take place in this book, I feel obligated to state that this story is not meant for children and may contain elements some might find offensive. Purchase at your own peril.

 

Short Summary

  • With the help of the very talented Jeff Kraven comes the first story of the notorious and mysterious Dr. Alpha.
  • The Dr. Alpha: Miracle Child storyline has been in development for a year.
  • The world of Dr. Alpha has been in development for over five years.
  • Even as a kid, I've always been fascinated with the art of storytelling. I ended up studying English and literature in college. And of course, I've always wanted to produce something people could one day read and enjoy. I also happen to be a fan of the pulp-era stories and the writers behind them. Dr. Alpha was born from the fast-paced pulp style.
  • While I enjoy the over-the-top action of Expendables or Commando - I could never keep myself away from diving into the underbelly of humanity. Asking what lies beneath a normally two-dimensional character. I guess that's why I love the paragon hero with unshakable morals, but can't help but write about villains. I mean, what better way to explore the more tragic side of humanity and with a tragically human character?
  • Dr. Alpha: Miracle Child is a complete story with a beginning and a definitive ending. No cliffhanger that'll force the reader to wait for the thrilling conclusion to the Miracle Child storyline. This isn't a part I. This will be a beginning, middle, and end. 
  • Dr. Alpha: Miracle Child will be a 112 page comic. However, the world of Dr. Alpha has been fleshed out far beyond the Miracle Child storyline. The book will have hints and easter eggs for future storylines and characters hidden in the details. Even some of the art shown here give hints to things that have occurred in the world. In other words, the promotional art is canon.
  • Any contribution will not only go toward funding this book but helping to launch a whole new franchise.​

​

What We Need & What You Get

What we're asking for:

  • My initial goal for this book will be $25,000 which will allow me to fund the comic, pay the printing costs, shipping, other additional costs, and have a small amount left over to jump start my next project.

What you get:

  • A full digital copy of the estimated 80 to 100-ish page Dr. Alpha comic. (Will update with a more precise number)
  • Other perks include a physical copy
  • A signed physical copy
  • The Doctor Alpha nuclear pin-up poster
  • Dr. Alpha "Evil Agenda" T-Shirt
  • Be drawn in as background character
  • Be drawn in as a background superhero
  • Be drawn in as a background villain

The Oculux Hero Exclusive and the Oculux Villain Exclusive will ask for a picture reference or an avatar reference (as long as you own the copyright and give permission to use it in the Dr. Alpha comic-book. We retain all rights to any and all characters that appear or are written into the comic to be used in Dr. Alpha: Miracle Child or any possible future works unless otherwise agreed upon.) You can also suggest a theme, powers, and a name for your hero or villain. (within reason - boundaries are pretty lax)

Lady Midnight: The Jolly Goodbye (The Dr. Alpha Christmas Special)

They say depression hits hardest around the holidays. For Lady Midnight, this year is shaping up to be the darkest Christmas of her young life when dangerous old enemies appear to carry out a mysterious vendetta. And with her boss out of commission, an escaped villain might be her only hope of protecting the city. Where will the night go? Will Lady Midnight live to see the dawn? As the old saying goes: There are no heroes in Orb City.

Lady Midnight: The Jolly Goodbye is a noir-style short superhero adventure inspired by Frank Miller's Sin City. The physical copy of this story will be included in the final Dr. Alpha: Miracle Child comic. The digital copy, however, will be accessible to ALL backers by Christmas Day. This story is backer-exclusive and also exclusive only to backers who back this campaign. Any future copies or printings of Dr. Alpha: Miracle Child will NOT contain this story. This is a thank you to everyone who supported my project early and from the ground level.

Planned Stretch Goals:

  • At $15,000 - Full color (UNLOCKED)
  • At $25,000 - Perfect binding (UNLOCKED)
  • At $25,000 - Lady Midnight: The Jolly Goodbye - Dr. Alpha Christmas Special (UNLOCKED)

These will be extra short stories involving Dr. Alpha spanning from adventures to simple yet vital parts of his life. If you like the main story, you will definitely enjoy these. 

  • At $40,000 -The New Kid short story. Get a glimpse at Dr. Alpha and his crew from their elementary school days through the perspective of a very unlikely person (UNLOCKED)
  • At $60,000 - The Sound of Her Name short story. Alan Moore's Joker once famously said all it takes for someone to go mad is one bad day. What he never mentioned, was that for there to be a bad day, there had to be a good day first. (LOCKED)
  • At $80,000 - One Took Over the Cuckoo's Nest - a short adventure story inspired by One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest. (LOCKED)
  • At $100,000 - Fear and Laughter in Las Vegas - a short adventure story where Dr. Alpha and the crazy, busty anti-hero American Jane are on the run from some very dangerous enemies as they go on a Hunter S. Thompson inspired romp through Las Vegas. (LOCKED)

 

The Impact

  • .I will be creating a project I am passionate about, made for anyone wanting to dive into something new right from the ground floor.
  • You will be helping to fund a project that is 100% independent, 100% creator-owned, and free of corporate oversight or company mandates. Help bring passion back into modern comics and foster an environment that allows creators to create.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • This is the first comic that I've ever produced and this is the first crowdfunding project I've run. So I have some new and interesting challenges ahead.
  • However, I've asked others for advice. I've been doing months of preparations and calculations/research to make sure that everything offered can and will be fulfilled.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know there are some people who just can't contribute, but you can still help:

  • Word of mouth is as powerful today as it was in the past. Giving a shoutout will always be a great help.
  • Indiegogo has great share tools!
